main event: Two bright, round objects were observed in the sky near Placerville, California on August 3, 1952. The objects were seen for approximately 7 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were estimated to be at an altitude of 2,000 feet and 1,500 miles away from the observer.
The objects were observed from a Ground Observer Corps (GOC) post in Pine Hill, about 45-55 miles from Placerville.
The objects were described as traveling parallel to the ground at high speed, before making a right-angle turn and disappearing from sight.
The weather was clear at the time of the sighting.
No other details were provided about physical evidence, identification actions, or results of the sighting.
